author: catwith1hat
content: <@755590043632140352> I saw on twitter, that you are working on faster block propagation via linear network coding. I spent some time today to write https://gist.github.com/catwith1hat/0558962e12ab393531ec4fd94c79be83 which takes a very different approach using erasure coding. It piggy backs on the mempool to seed erasure coding recovery, which is something that LNC can't do imho. It should be easier to deploy without requiring changes to EL/CLs or block format. I would be interested what you think of it. üòÉ
